items.title: 0CTF/TCTF 2019 Finals
items.description:
12 teams in total. Each team can have up to four players at the table.
Remote help is allowed.

Accommodations will be provided for qualified teams during the Final.

We will provide travel expense support, according to the travel distance of each team.

items.title: BCACTF I
items.description: BCACTF is a beginner focused CTF made for middle and high schoolers. BCACTF is organized by the Cybersecurity Club at Bergen County Academies, and funded by the Investment Analysis Group at Bergen County Academies.

items.title: CTF.Moscow 2019
items.description:
CTF.Moscow 2019 is to be held on June 10 in Moscow.

Venue: IIFD City Hall, 13 Myasnitskaya str., building 18.

Teams are invited on the basis of their performance in VolgaCTF 2019 Qualifier.

items.title: Midnight Sun CTF 2019 Finals
items.description:
WHY Midnight Sun CTF 
The Midnight Sun CTF started as a common interest between Networked Systems Security (NSS) group at KTH, CTF Team HackingForSoju and Saab to promote the cyber security eco-system in the Stockholm region. This is why we connect the Midnight Sun CTF to the CyberSecurity and Privacy (CySeP) summer school and plan to have them each June together. 

WHEN and WHERE 
The final event is in June (15th-16th) in Stockholm, Sweden, with the online qualifier in April (5th-6th). The final event is hosted by the NSS group at the premises of the School of EECS at the main KTH campus, right after the end of CySeP.

items.title: Google Capture The Flag 2019 (Quals)
items.description:
More information will be announced in the following weeks.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzFuwljOj8Y

https://security.googleblog.com/2019/05/google-ctf-2019-is-here.html

https://buildyourfuture.withgoogle.com/events/ctf

Subscribe to https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/google-ctf for more updates.

items.title: ISITDTU CTF 2019 Quals
items.description:
ISITDTU CTF 2019 is geared more towards university and high school students.
Some notes for you:

1. The registration page has been opened. You can register on our website https://ctf.isitdtu.com/
2. Date and time: 18:00 ICT 29 June - 18:00 ICT 30 June.
3. This ctf is an online jeopady ctf, runs for 24 hours.
4. The challenges include PWN, REVERSE, CRYPTO, WEB, MISC.
5. Everyone can join and enjoy it.
Top 10 (5 International teams and 5 Vietnamese teams) will be invited to join the final.
6. The final round will be held at the Duy Tan university Da Nang Viet Nam. We happy to say we will support accommodation.

items.title: Canadian Institute for Cybersecurity_Capture the Flag
items.description: CIC is inviting all undergraduate Computer Science, Software Engineering and Information Technology Students across Canada to participate “Individually” in a CTF online competition qualifier in June.

image.accessibilityText: Canadian Institute for Cybersecurity_Capture the Flag

items.title: Cinsects CTF 2019
items.description:
The CTF will consist of multiple challenges/services involving multiple virtual machines. The team's virtual machines are hosted by us. They may will have different operating systems.

The level of access to the different Virtual machines is different for each scenario and virtual machine.

The teams can start, stop and reset their own virtual machines.

items.title: peaCTF 2019
items.description: peaCTF, Phillips Exeter Academy’s Capture the Flag, is a free online computer security competition for middle school and high school students. Teams of 1-5 competitors decrypt, hack, reverse engineer, and search for flags hidden in puzzles written by PEA students. Gaining points with each flag, participants compete for the highest score!

items.title: Canadian Institute for Cybersecurity_CTF_Final
items.description: CIC is inviting all undergraduate Computer Science, Software Engineering and Information Technology Students across Canada to participate “Individually” in a CTF online final competition in August.
